intro: Hieracium zophothrincum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellowish to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in meadows and grassy areas. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in temperate climates. Hieracium zophothrincum is a perennial species that spreads through rhizomes and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
